org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item

Class PTextLines

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.ReportItem
      • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.AbstractText
        • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.PTextLines

  • public class PTextLines
extends AbstractText
    Similar to PText, but allows for multi-line text. PTextLines computes individual line heights and its total height (and width) using FontInfo, so that lines are spaced vertically as intended. Thus PTextLines.getHeight() should reflect the total height of all the lines of text contained; PTextLines.addHeight()/setHeight() can be used to add extra space underneath the rendered text.

    Like PText, PTextLines defaults to left-aligned text.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.AbstractText

    • Constructor Detail

      • PTextLines

        public PTextLines(FontInfo font,
          float width,
          java.lang.String text)
        Constructs a PTextLines using the specified font, width and text, adding line breaks as necessary to make text fit within width. The height will be automatically set to the total height of the resulting lines.

        Note that carriage return/line feed characters (\r\n) in text will be printed as line breaks in the pdf.

        Parameters:
        font - Contains font information.
        width - The desired width.
        text - The text to display.
        See Also:
        FontInfo.getFit(String, float)

      • PTextLines

        public PTextLines(FontInfo font,
          java.lang.String... text)
        Creates a new PTextLines with line breaks between each member of the text array (for convenience, this is a varargs paramter). Line feed and carriage return (\n, \r) characters in text will be ignored.

      • PTextLines

        public PTextLines(SimplePDF pdf,
          float width,
          java.lang.String text)
        A shortcut to PTextLines(pdf.getFontInfo(), width, text).

      • PTextLines
